data.title: Champions League stays on Sky Italia for 2024 to 2027 cycle in '€220m a year' deal
data.meta_description: Comacast-owned pay-TV broadcaster Sky Italia has secured a package for 185 of 203 Champions League games per season.
data.text:
Pay-TV broadcaster Sky Italia will continue to show live coverage of Uefa’s club competitions after extending its rights deal with European soccer’s governing body for the 2024/27 cycle.

Contract:

Sky Italia lands exclusive rights package for 185 of 203 Uefa Champions League matches per season

Renewal includes all 342 Uefa Europa League and Uefa Europa Conference League matches

Uefa Super Cup rights also covered in deal from 2024/25 season

Amazon previously confirmed Prime Video has retained its deal for the first pick of Wednesday games, agreeing a €110 million a year extension

Context:

Sky Italia continues its long-running broadcast partnership with Uefa, with the current contract for the 2021 to 2024 cycle seeing the network air 121 of 137 Champions League games per season, with the pay-TV broadcaster reportedly paying between €100 million (US$109 million) and €110 million (US$120 million) per season.

The increase in the number of matches Sky Italia will air for 2024 to 2027 reflects the new format of European soccer’s elite club competition and will see the rights fee increase. According to Milano Finanza, the broadcaster will be paying €220 million (US$241 million) per year for the deal covering all three European club competitions.

Comment:

“We are really excited to continue being Uefa’s partner and to offer our subscribers exclusively the big matches of these important European competitions until 2027,” said Sky Italia chief executive Andrea Duilio.

“With the renewal of the Uefa Champions League, Uefa Europa League and Uefa Europa Conference League, our Casa dello Sport will host many seasons of exclusive live events.”
